meanings.definition: Not willing to forgive or show mercy.
meanings.sent1: The unforgiving teacher never gave second chances.
meanings.sent2: The unforgiving storm destroyed the fragile crops.
meanings.sent3: The unforgiving referee refused to overlook any fouls.
meanings.sent4: The unforgiving winter frost killed all the delicate flowers.
meanings.sent5: The unforgiving judge sentenced the criminal to the maximum penalty.

meanings.sent1: The unforgiving desert sun beat down relentlessly.
meanings.sent2: The unforgiving boss never praised any effort.
meanings.sent3: The unforgiving alarm clock woke him up abruptly every morning.
meanings.sent4: The unforgiving truth hit her hard, leaving no room for denial.
meanings.sent5: The unforgiving terrain made the hike extremely challenging.

meanings.definition: Not allowing for mistakes or errors.
meanings.sent1: The unforgiving computer program crashed at the slightest error.
meanings.sent2: The unforgiving deadline left no room for revisions.
meanings.sent3: The unforgiving scale showed the exact weight without any tolerance.
meanings.sent4: The unforgiving traffic jam made him late for the important meeting.
meanings.sent5: The unforgiving rules of the game penalized any missteps severely.
